verses.roman:
ṛco yajūṁṣi sāmāni
dvijo 'dhītyānuvindate
madhu-kulyā ghṛta-kulyāḥ
payaḥ-kulyāś ca tat phalam

synonyms: ṛcaḥ—the mantras of the Ṛg Veda; yajūṁṣi—those of the Yajur Veda; sāmāni—and those of the Sāma Veda; dvijaḥ—a brāhmaṇa; adhītya—studying; anuvindate—obtains; madhu-kulyāḥ—rivers of honey; ghṛta-kulyāḥ—rivers of ghee; payaḥ-kulyāḥ—rivers of milk; ca—and; tat—that; phalam—fruit.
translation: By studying this Bhāgavatam, a brāhmaṇa can enjoy the same rivers of honey, ghee and milk he enjoys by studying the hymns of the Ṛg, Yajur and Sāma Vedas.
